text: Do all of you write your chaincode (golang) in 1 file?
I’m trying some packaging - very simple code - and the pointers give some problems..
Don’t know if this acts up through the shim or not.
<@U25R83TAP> there’s no restrictions on number of files that can be in a chaincode package. If golang likes it (as in `go build`), it should be fine
if you do go lang build, you should remove the generated exe before running in `net` mode
to avoid getting it included in the deployed package

Perhaps this helps for everybody… You can’t extend existing types - in the case of chaincode *SimpleChaincode - in another package.
This throws `cannot define new methods on non-local type global.SimpleChaincode`
(I defined the struct in another package global)
Thanks <@U0ULK2JPP> … I was structuring it for readability in different files and tried to put them in different packages as well …. but apparently there are some limits :slightly_smiling_face:
I checked this and seemed to work: <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-208>. no response since that :slightly_smiling_face:
what do to with it, close?
